revised_title: An Anatomical Analysis of a Monstrous Calf
tldr: A letter from Reverend Mr. John Craig describes the discovery of a monstrous calf's head with unique anatomical features. The calf's upper jaw was divided into two halves, each with a distinct eye and nostril, and the lower jaw bent around, positioning the tongue on the forehead. The calf's brain was surprisingly small, fitting into a cavity no larger than an ordinary walnut. This unusual case offers an opportunity for further anatomical study.
